content.raw:
This can also be considered a visualization question. The gap represents space between two laser readings. Should this gap be:

1. Light blue: representing no hit, which is typically partially correct.
2. Dark blue: representing a hit, which again is typically partially correct.
3. Leave as a gap: representing the area which is questionable.

Thoughts?
content.html:
This can also be considered a visualization question. The gap represents space between two laser readings. Should this gap be:

  1. Light blue: representing no hit, which is typically partially correct.
  2. Dark blue: representing a hit, which again is typically partially correct.
  3. Leave as a gap: representing the area which is questionable.

Thoughts?

content.html:
this fixes the crash and test passes

diff -r 23cd7ba34f78 gazebo/rendering/LaserVisual.cc
--- a/gazebo/rendering/LaserVisual.cc   Fri Jun 19 15:15:55 2015 -0700
+++ b/gazebo/rendering/LaserVisual.cc   Fri Jun 26 11:12:01 2015 -0700
@@ -154,13 +154,13 @@
       math::Vector3 noHitPt = (axis * noHitRange) + offset.pos;

       // Draw the lines that represent each simulated ray
-      if (i >= dPtr->rayLines[j]->GetPointCount()/2)
+      if (i >= dPtr->rayLines[j]->GetPointCount()*0.5)
       {
         dPtr->rayLines[j]->AddPoint(offset.pos);
         if (std::isinf(r))
           dPtr->rayLines[j]->AddPoint(noHitPt);
         else
-          dPtr->rayLines[j]->SetPoint(i*2+1, pt);
+          dPtr->rayLines[j]->AddPoint(pt);
       }
       else
       {

content.raw:
I get seg-faults when I insert a hokuyo into a world that has objects within range:

~~~
[Err] [DynamicLines.cc:86] EXCEPTION: Point index[537] is out of bounds[0-536]

Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'gazebo::common::Exception'

Program received signal SIGABRT, Aborted.
0x00007ffff671acc9 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6)
    at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:56
56	../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c: No such file or directory.
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff671acc9 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6)
    at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:56
#1  0x00007ffff671e0d8 in __GI_abort () at abort.c:89
#2  0x00007ffff6d1f535 in __gnu_cxx::__verbose_terminate_handler() ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#3  0x00007ffff6d1d6d6 in ?? () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#4  0x00007ffff6d1d703 in std::terminate() ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#5  0x00007ffff6d1d976 in __cxa_rethrow ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#6  0x00007ffff7343596 in QEventLoop::exec(QFlags<QEventLoop::ProcessEventsFlag>) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtCore.so.4
#7  0x00007ffff7348b79 in QCoreApplication::exec() ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtCore.so.4
#8  0x00007ffff7772cdb in gazebo::gui::run (_argc=_argc@entry=2, 
    _argv=_argv@entry=0x7fffffffdc98)
    at /home/scpeters/ws/gazebo/src/gazebo/gazebo/gui/GuiIface.cc:308
#9  0x00000000004014ea in main (_argc=2, _argv=0x7fffffffdc98)
    at /home/scpeters/ws/gazebo/src/gazebo/gazebo/gui/main.cc:25
(gdb)
~~~

Note that I don't get a seg-fault if I insert the hokuyo and then insert a box within its range after the visualization has appeared.

Also, I get a seg-fault when loading `test/worlds/laser_vertical.world`; it may be the same root cause as the first test case.

I get seg-faults when I insert a hokuyo into a world that has objects within range:

[Err] [DynamicLines.cc:86] EXCEPTION: Point index[537] is out of bounds[0-536]

Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'gazebo::common::Exception'

Program received signal SIGABRT, Aborted.
0x00007ffff671acc9 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6)
    at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:56
56  ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c: No such file or directory.
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff671acc9 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6)
    at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:56
#1  0x00007ffff671e0d8 in __GI_abort () at abort.c:89
#2  0x00007ffff6d1f535 in __gnu_cxx::__verbose_terminate_handler() ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#3  0x00007ffff6d1d6d6 in ?? () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#4  0x00007ffff6d1d703 in std::terminate() ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#5  0x00007ffff6d1d976 in __cxa_rethrow ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#6  0x00007ffff7343596 in QEventLoop::exec(QFlags<QEventLoop::ProcessEventsFlag>) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtCore.so.4
#7  0x00007ffff7348b79 in QCoreApplication::exec() ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtCore.so.4
#8  0x00007ffff7772cdb in gazebo::gui::run (_argc=_argc@entry=2, 
    _argv=_argv@entry=0x7fffffffdc98)
    at /home/scpeters/ws/gazebo/src/gazebo/gazebo/gui/GuiIface.cc:308
#9  0x00000000004014ea in main (_argc=2, _argv=0x7fffffffdc98)
    at /home/scpeters/ws/gazebo/src/gazebo/gazebo/gui/main.cc:25
(gdb)

Note that I don't get a seg-fault if I insert the hokuyo and then insert a box within its range after the visualization has appeared.

Also, I get a seg-fault when loading test/worlds/laser_vertical.world; it may be the same root cause as the first test case.
